1.content:
You are a business man in his early twenties. You are kind of small and young looking for your age, so can sometimes pass for a teenager, but that has only made things harder in your new life in the business world. You try to stay optimistic, but things can often get you down, so you come to the park sometimes to relax.

While there, you notice the playground, which is full of small children playing, while being watched by their mothers on benches like yours. You sit there for a while, watching the kids, and relaxing to the thought of being that worry free to just have a mother take care of you.

After a bit, the kids are taken away by their mothers one by one. You notice that, despite all the kids being gone, there is still one woman remaining. She looks very young, maybe early twenties, and has a caring look to her. She also seems to have a stroller with her. Just then, she sees you looking at her, and stands up and walks toward you, pushing the stroller.

As she does, you can see that the stroller is empty. Hello, she says.

Oh, um, hello. What's the stroller for?

Oh, well, just in case I need it I suppose.

Why? Did you want a ride?
1.title: Stress relief

choices: Someone sees you in the stoller
11.content:
You couldn't explain why, maybe part of you thought that she was joking, but you said yes

Oh, she uttered, seeming surprised by your affirmative response. Well, that's fine. Hop on in

She adjusted the straps and you sat down, and were surprised that despite it being very snug, you were able to fit. She then strapped you in, and began pushing the stroller.
11.title: Say yes

choices: ...in your apartment with noises in the kitchen.
112.content:
This is insane. You're a young adult in your early twenties and being pushed in a stroller by some stranger. For one, it's weird that she's pushing around an empty stroller and you're even weirder for filling it.

Perhaps...you're just tired of it all.

Yes, this is just a way to get out of the norm of a busy routine that has simply exhausted you after just a few years of working. Even though this might ruin your life if anyone catches you being pushed in a stroller, you don't seem to care. Given no breaks, no real benefits, and more importantly, no love, it seems that life has pushed you to the breaking point.

Despite acknowledging this, you yawn. The wind brushes gently against your face and you hear the young woman hum beautifully behind you. She doesn't seem at all perturbed but then again, she's probably not in the right mind. It's a shame because she seems to be quite the beautiful girl. Given your youthful complexion, she probably doesn't even know you're likely as old as her.

You can hardly worry about all of that. Feeling the most relaxed in months, which is sad, you easily fall asleep and drift away. A small smile grows on your face as you forget about the hardships of being a working adult.

When you wake up, you find yourself...
112.title: Go to Sleep

choices: No, that's strange. Why would she be concerned? (More skeptical)
Something off about her. You'd rather she leave. (More rejectful)
1121.content:
You wake up to see the familiar ceiling of your lone bedroom. In this small apartment that you've been renting for about a year since you moved into the city, there's little comfort except for the fact that you can sometimes go to rest and vent your frustrations alone.

You frown and a small tear runs through your eyes. Of course, such a strange encounter would be a dream. No, it might be for the best.

While thinking these sad thoughts, you hear a high pitch whistling in the kitchen. It takes you a moment before you spring out of the bed and curse.

"Shit, did I leave the kettle on?!"

You quickly throw your blanket and step out. Sure enough, you see a pot that you don't remember placing but that doesn't matter. With a hurried breath, you quickly turn off the stove. It looks like there's still water so maybe it wasn't long since you possibly left it. More importantly, why did you go to take a nap and leave the kettle running?

Unsure, your eyes wander to the rest of the room and adjacent to the small kitchen where you stand, you freeze to you see someone on your couch staring at you with slight surprise.

Preview  

"Ah...I was going to get that."

It's that woman in your dreams.

You blink and feel your throat drying then look to the front entrance where you see the stroller that you had fitted yourself in. Now with a clearer mind, you sweat and return to look at her with concern.

"Uh...did you bring me here?"

The woman hesitates before nodding and smiles reassuringly. "I found your keys and address. You were quite exhausted and so I decided it's best to take you home."

"Oh..."

You smile wryly, then look down. Feeling ashamed, you chuckle bitterly and shake your head. "...Sorry, I...don't know what came over me. I..."

"Hey," she cuts in gently causing you to look up at her. She gives the most beautiful, hopeful smile, "...it's okay. I didn't realize it but when I saw your ID, it seems you're only a few years younger than me. It surprised me but that must be a good thing, right?"

You snort. "I guess."

People have taken advantage of you thanks to your complexion so you think it's a blessing and a curse. If your life kept up like this, you're certain you'd look older thanks to stress.

"Do you live alone?"

The next question makes you hesitate but there's no reason to lie even if it causes you feel pathetic so you nod and don't say anything more.

The woman's face softens and she hums, "That can't be good. Living alone and also looking so exhausted..."

You shrug, taking it as just a cruel fate of your life so far. Staring at the door, you decide it's time to end this meaningless chat.

"Well miss," you begin, clearing your throat, "...thank you for taking care of me, but I think I'm good. You don't have to worry about me anymore. I'm sure you have better things to do."

The woman blinks and then to your surprise, she stifles a laugh. You stare at her confused but her eyes twinkle at you with amusement. She explains herself.

"Sorry but saying that in such a sad tone isn't convincing, especially by me."

You didn't realize that your voice sounded so off and blush with embarrassment. She doesn't seem to care though and smiles brightly as your image reflects in her soft blue eyes.

"My name is Angel. What's yours?"

Introducing herself, you feel a little ashamed that you hadn't asked for her name beforehand. With a weird, but kind stranger, you didn't expect your encounter with her to go this way.

Regardless you tell her your name as a courtesy, but think that it won't really matter in the end. At least, that's what you think until she moves makes a sudden offer.

"How about we live together? I can help you with your exhaustion and your troubles. All you need to do is relax and allow me to take care of you. What do you think?"

Wait...what?

You have no idea what to think but then remember that she's the one that allowed you to be pushed in a stroller. What's your thought process?
1121.title: A Lovely Intruder

1122.content:
Some time passes, and you finally begin to stir. Your eyes slowly open, as you feel completely rested. You couldn't remember a time when you had slept better.

As, you're waking up, you start to stretch out your arms, and have to stop when they bump into something. Your bed in your apartment isn't facing a wall, so you're confused for a moment. As your eyes open completely, you see what your arm made contact with. It was a wooden pole, one of many. You are completely surrounded by these poles, and after taking another moment, you realize what this is, a crib. You are inside a crib large enough for a grown man, complete with all the accessories. Beneath you is clearly a baby mattress, though you've never seen one this large before, and there are various stuffed animals around you. There is also a mobile hanging above you playing music.

The worst has yet to come though as you begin to examine yourself. You are wearing white feety pajamas. Even worse, your examination reveals another item on your person. You tried to deny it at first, but sure enough you are wearing a large adult sized diaper under your feety pajamas.

Still surprised by what you're seeing, you take a bit more time to examine the room. The lights are turned off, but you can still see, especially with a nightlight that is plugged in near you. You see that the walls are...
1122.title: ...in a strange, baby-like room.

11222.content:
You really couldn't believe your eyes. The walls of the room were completely pink. As you looked around, you could see a white changing table (extra large of course) on one wall clearly filled with various baby changing supplies, and a rocking chair against a corner. There was also a swing and a bouncer.

On the wall, you could see various disney princess motifs, and along the edge of the ceiling, there was a border decorated with female baby disney characters, and one wall had letters on it, spelling out P-R-I-N-C-E-S-S.

This was, without a doubt, the weirdest experience of your life.

What did you do next?
11222.title: Pink, a baby girl's room

112221.content: You decided to first get out of the crib, but as you went to, you discovered that the crib door was locked, and could not be opened from the inside (baby proof). You wanted to got over from above, but it was covered by a net to prevent crawlers from getting out of their cribs.
112221.title: Try to get out

choices: The woman from the night before
112222.content:
On the side of the crib, you could see there was a baby monitor. Figuring that it must be connected somewhere, perhaps to the lady from the night before, you decide to call out.

Um...Hello? Is anybody there?...

Suddenly the door opens and a light comes on. You are momentarily blinded by the light, but when your eyes adjust you see...
112222.title: Call out for someone

114.title: Someone sees you in the stoller

info.brief_description: One lonely day at the park, you have an encounter to change your life.
info.description: You are a man who has always longed for a reprieve from a stressful life. Maybe today you'll get it. (Inspired by a since deleted story)
